newsitem.title: USA: FCC PEGS US CORN CROP AT 9.58 BLN BU, SOY 2.73 BLN.
newsitem.headline: FCC PEGS US CORN CROP AT 9.58 BLN BU, SOY 2.73 BLN.

text.p: Farmers Commodities Corp said on Wednesday it pegged 1997/98 U.S. corn production at 9.582 billion bushels and soybeans at 2.731 billion bushels.
FCC estimated the U.S. corn yield at 129.5 bushels per acre and the U.S. soybean yield at 39.1 bushels.
The U.S. Agriculture Department in July put U.S. corn production at 9.70 billion bushels. Last year's production was 9.293 billion bushels, according to USDA.
USDA last month pegged U.S. soybean production at 2.690 billion bushels, compared with last year's actual output of 2.382 billion.
